front: Tb118 process
back: 1. Isolate 2. Safe to touch test ( pen on proving unit, sweep boiler and pipework , proving unit) 3.polarity test ( attach live neutral earth to boiler terminals,turn on power, switch to socket on tester) 4. Earth loop impedence 5.isolate power 6. Safe isolation test ( voltage tester to proving unit, earth-live,  earth - neutral, neutral - live, back to proving unit)

front: What are the main points of 26.9 (a),(b),(c),(Ca),(d)
back: (a) the effectiveness of any flue (b) The supply of combustion air (c) it's operating pressure or heat input (Ca) Where heat input or OP cannot be taken then it's combustion performance can be used (d) It's safe operation

front: What is section (a) of 26.9
What is section (b) of 26.9
What is section (c) of 26.9
back: (c) it's operating pressure or heat input

front: What is section (Ca) of 26.9
back: (Ca) Where not operating pressure or heat input can be obtained, then it's combustion performance can be used

front: What is section (d) of 26.9
back: (d) it's operation as to ensure it's safe operation

front: Which regulation refers to 'the 9 key checks'
Explain the 9 key checks of Regulation 36
back: •date of inspection  •address of inspection  •landlord name and address. •description of and the location of each appliance  •any safety defects •any remedial work undertaken  •confirmation of 26.9 checks • name and signature of engineer •registration number of engineer and company

front: How should ideal flues be sealed?
